tasks.title: Setup Node.js and NPM Environment
tasks.description: Initialize the development environment with Node.js and NPM for the Brick Chain Blaster game following MVP approach
tasks.details:
1. Install latest LTS version of Node.js
2. Create project directory structure (src, assets, public folders)
3. Initialize NPM project with `npm init`
4. Configure package.json with necessary scripts and dependencies
5. Configure .gitignore for Node.js projects
6. Setup ESLint and Prettier for code quality
7. Create README.md with project overview
8. Initialize Git repository
9. Document all setup steps for team reference
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Node and NPM versions are compatible with Phaser 3 requirements (using node -v, npm -v)
2. Ensure package.json is correctly configured with all required dependencies and scripts
3. Verify npm install runs without errors
4. Confirm node_modules folder is created properly
5. Ensure the project structure follows best practices and includes all necessary directories

tasks.title: Setup Phaser 3 with TypeScript
tasks.description: Install and configure Phaser 3 game framework with TypeScript support using create-phaser template as part of the MVP approach
tasks.details:
1. Install Phaser 3 using `npm install phaser`
2. Setup TypeScript with `npm install typescript ts-loader`
3. Configure tsconfig.json for Phaser compatibility and optimize TypeScript settings
4. Create webpack configuration for development and production
5. Setup development server with hot-reload
6. Create basic game structure following Phaser 3 scene architecture
7. Implement simple loading screen to verify setup
8. Create skeleton structure for game scenes and objects
9. Configure build scripts for production deployment
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify development server runs without errors using `npm start`
2. Confirm basic Phaser scene renders correctly in browser
3. Test TypeScript compilation works correctly with Phaser types
4. Verify hot-reload functionality during development
5. Run `tsc` command to ensure TypeScript compilation completes without errors
6. Test production build using `npm build` command

tasks.title: Configure CI/CD with GitHub Actions and Vercel
tasks.description: Set up continuous integration and deployment pipeline using GitHub Actions with automatic preview deployments to Vercel
tasks.details:
1. Create GitHub repository for the project
2. Setup Vercel account and connect to GitHub repository
3. Configure Vercel for static site hosting
4. Create GitHub Actions workflow file (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
5. Configure workflow to run tests, lint code, and build project
6. Setup automatic deployment to Vercel preview environments for pull requests
7. Configure production deployment on main branch merges
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify automatic tests run when creating a Pull Request in GitHub repository
2. Confirm Vercel preview URL is automatically generated after successful tests
3. Verify production deployment automatically runs when merging to main branch
4. Test deployed application functionality across different browsers
5. Create a test pull request to verify the entire CI pipeline runs correctly

tasks.title: Implement Game Field and Physics
tasks.description: Create the basic game field with boundaries and implement Arcade Physics for ball movement as the first implementation task for Phase 1 (Basic Breakout Game MVP)
tasks.details:
1. Create a new game scene with proper dimensions for desktop
2. Setup Arcade Physics in the scene
3. Implement game boundaries with collision detection
4. Create world bounds that reflect the ball
5. Implement physics properties for the ball's movement and collisions
6. Add debug visualization for physics bodies and collision points during development
7. Ensure consistent physics behavior across different frame rates
8. Set up the basic screen layout and background for the game
9. Add FPS counter and performance metrics for debugging
10. Ensure the game field scales appropriately across different resolutions
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify ball correctly bounces off screen boundaries
2. Confirm physics system operates reliably at consistent FPS
3. Test game field scaling across various resolutions
4. Verify all collision events are properly detected
5. Test ball collision with boundaries
6. Verify physics properties like bounce and velocity behave as expected
7. Test at different frame rates to ensure consistent behavior

tasks.title: Implement Paddle and Ball Control
tasks.description: Create the player-controlled paddle and implement mouse-based aiming and ball launching mechanics for Phase 1 MVP
tasks.details:
1. Create paddle sprite at bottom of screen
2. Implement mouse control for paddle movement
3. Implement mouse-over aim line visualization
4. Calculate angle between paddle and mouse position
5. Implement click-to-launch single ball mechanics (multiple balls will be in Phase 2)
6. Add physics body to ball with proper collision properties
7. Implement ball-paddle collision logic with appropriate reflection angles
8. Add visual feedback for aiming direction
9. Implement logic for when the ball is missed (falls below screen)
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify paddle moves smoothly with mouse movement
2. Test aim line follows mouse cursor accurately and displays correct angle
3. Verify ball launches in the correct direction based on aim line
4. Test ball-paddle collision behavior and reflection physics
5. Ensure mouse controls are responsive and intuitive
6. Verify appropriate events/handling occur when ball is missed
7. Test overall gameplay flow from aiming to launching to ball interaction

tasks.title: Implement Basic Block System
tasks.description: Create the block/brick system with HP and collision detection
tasks.details:
1. Create Block class with HP property
2. Implement visual representation of blocks with different HP levels
3. Setup collision detection between balls and blocks
4. Implement HP reduction on collision with visual feedback
5. Add block destruction animation and sound effects when HP reaches zero
6. Create basic block layout system for testing (advanced patterns will be implemented in later tasks)
7. Implement basic score counting logic when blocks are destroyed
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify blocks render correctly on screen
2. Test block collision and HP reduction when hit by ball
3. Verify visual state changes as HP decreases
4. Confirm blocks are destroyed correctly when HP reaches zero
5. Test destruction effects (animation, sound) play appropriately
6. Verify ball bounces physically correct after block collision
7. Test performance stability with multiple blocks on screen
8. Verify score increases correctly when blocks are destroyed

tasks.title: Implement HUD and Score System
tasks.description: Create the heads-up display showing score, wave number, and remaining balls for the MVP version of the block-breaking game
tasks.details:
1. Design HUD layout with score, wave counter, and ball count
2. Implement score calculation based on block destruction
3. Create wave/level counter and progression logic
4. Display remaining ball count (MVP supports single ball only)
5. Design visually clear and intuitive UI elements
6. Ensure UI elements are positioned to not interfere with gameplay
7. Implement real-time score updates as blocks are destroyed
8. Create visual indicators for wave/level progression
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify score updates accurately in real-time during gameplay
2. Confirm wave/level display changes correctly as game progresses
3. Test ball count display updates correctly
4. Verify HUD visibility and readability across different resolutions
5. Ensure UI element placement is intuitive and doesn't interfere with gameplay
6. Test visual consistency of all UI elements

tasks.title: Implement Game Over and Restart
tasks.description: Create game over condition, screen, and restart functionality to complete the game cycle for the MVP
tasks.details:
1. Implement game over conditions and logic:
   - When player loses all balls
   - When blocks fill the screen/reach bottom boundary
2. Create game over screen with final score display
3. Implement score saving functionality using local storage
4. Implement restart button functionality that fully resets the game state
5. Implement win condition and screen when all blocks are destroyed
6. Create smooth transitions between game states (play → game over/win → restart)
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify game over triggers correctly when player loses all balls
2. Verify game over triggers when blocks reach the bottom boundary
3. Confirm game over screen displays properly with accurate final score
4. Test that high scores are correctly saved to and retrieved from local storage
5. Verify restart button properly resets all game elements and state
6. Confirm win screen appears when all blocks are destroyed
7. Test that state transitions (play → game over/win → restart) work smoothly

tasks.title: Create PWA Configuration
tasks.description: Configure the game as a Progressive Web App for desktop browsers as part of Phase 1 MVP deployment
tasks.details:
1. Create manifest.json with app information including icons and color scheme
2. Generate app icons in various sizes for different devices and contexts
3. Implement service worker for offline gameplay capability
4. Configure caching strategies for game assets to ensure fast loading
5. Add install prompt for desktop browsers
6. Optimize web performance for stable deployment
7. Ensure PWA meets Lighthouse score of 90+ for PWA criteria
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test PWA installation on all major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
2. Verify game loads and plays correctly in offline mode
3. Confirm service worker registration and cache mechanisms function properly
4. Check that PWA icons and splash screens display correctly
5. Verify install prompt appears appropriately
6. Run Lighthouse audit to ensure PWA compliance and performance score
7. Test the complete user journey from installation to offline gameplay

tasks.title: Implement Multi-Ball Chain System
tasks.description: Extend the single ball system to support multiple balls fired in sequence as part of Phase 2 (Multi-Launch Mechanism) implementation
tasks.details:
1. Modify ball launch system to support multiple balls fired sequentially with a single aim
2. Implement sequential firing with configurable delay between balls
3. Create ball pool for efficient object reuse and optimize multi-ball physics handling
4. Add visual indicators for total ball count, remaining balls, and firing angle in UI
5. Implement consistent timing control system for ball launch intervals
6. Ensure all balls follow the same initial trajectory based on the single aiming action
7. Optimize performance for handling multiple balls simultaneously on screen
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify balls are fired sequentially with the configured intervals
2. Confirm all balls follow the exact same initial trajectory based on aim
3. Test performance with various ball counts to ensure no degradation
4. Verify ball count and firing information are accurately displayed in UI
5. Confirm each ball maintains proper individual physics interactions
6. Test multi-ball firing with different ball counts and intervals
7. Measure performance with large numbers of balls on screen simultaneously

subtasks.title: 구현: 다중 볼 발사 시스템 설계
subtasks.description: 단일 조준으로 다수의 볼을 순차적으로 발사하는 시스템 기본 구조 설계
subtasks.details:
1. 볼 발사 메커니즘을 단일 볼에서 다중 볼로 확장할 수 있는 구조 설계
2. 조준 각도 및 발사 명령을 모든 볼에 일관되게 적용하는 방식 구현

subtasks.title: 구현: 순차적 타이밍 컨트롤

subtasks.title: 구현: 다중 볼 UI 표시

tasks.title: Implement Fast-Forward Feature
tasks.description: Add fast-forward functionality to speed up gameplay with visual indicators
tasks.details:
1. Separate game logic from animation rendering
2. Implement speed multiplier system (1x, 2x, 4x)
3. Create fast-forward button with visual state
4. Add progress bar to show remaining balls/time
5. Implement instant completion option
6. Ensure physics calculations remain accurate at higher speeds
7. Add visual effects to indicate fast-forward state
tasks.testStrategy: Test different speed settings for consistency in physics. Verify progress bar accurately reflects remaining time. Test instant completion functionality. Ensure game state remains consistent regardless of speed.

tasks.title: Implement Pattern-Based Block Generation
tasks.description: Create a system for generating blocks in predefined patterns with increasing difficulty
tasks.details:
1. Design pattern library data structure
2. Create several basic block patterns
3. Implement pattern selection and placement logic
4. Add wave-based difficulty progression
5. Implement HP scaling based on wave number
6. Create pattern variations through rotation and mirroring
7. Add random element to pattern selection
tasks.testStrategy: Test pattern generation for visual correctness. Verify HP scaling works correctly with wave progression. Test random pattern selection for good distribution. Ensure patterns fit correctly within game boundaries.

tasks.title: Implement Ball Count Increase Mechanism
tasks.description: Create system to increase ball count based on blocks destroyed
tasks.details:
1. Implement block destruction counter
2. Define threshold for ball count increase
3. Create visual feedback when threshold is reached
4. Update ball count in HUD
5. Implement persistent ball count between turns
6. Add animation for ball count increase
7. Balance threshold values for game progression
tasks.testStrategy: Test block counter increments correctly. Verify ball count increases at the correct threshold. Test persistence between turns. Ensure visual feedback is clear to the player.

tasks.title: Implement Firebase Authentication
tasks.description: Integrate Firebase Authentication for user accounts and cloud save functionality
tasks.details:
1. Setup Firebase project and configure web app
2. Install Firebase SDK via npm
3. Implement authentication UI (login/register)
4. Create anonymous authentication for new users
5. Add account linking options
6. Implement auth state persistence
7. Create user profile management
tasks.testStrategy: Test authentication flow with different methods. Verify anonymous accounts can be upgraded. Test auth persistence between sessions. Ensure error handling for auth failures.

tasks.title: Implement Cloud Save with Firestore
tasks.description: Create cloud save functionality using Firestore to persist player progress
tasks.details:
1. Design Firestore data structure for player saves
2. Implement save/load functionality
3. Create automatic save points during gameplay
4. Add manual save option
5. Implement conflict resolution for offline play
6. Add data migration strategy for updates
7. Implement save data encryption for sensitive information
tasks.testStrategy: Test save/load functionality with different account states. Verify offline play and synchronization. Test data migration with mock legacy data. Ensure performance impact of save operations is minimal.

tasks.title: Implement Remote Config Integration
tasks.description: Integrate Firebase Remote Config for server-controlled game parameters
tasks.details:
1. Setup Remote Config in Firebase console
2. Define default values for configurable parameters
3. Implement config fetching on game start
4. Create fallback for offline mode
5. Add config caching for performance
6. Implement hot reloading of config changes
7. Create admin panel for config management
tasks.testStrategy: Test config fetching and application. Verify fallback to defaults works correctly. Test config updates during gameplay. Ensure performance impact of config fetching is minimal.

tasks.title: Implement Ad Reward System
tasks.description: Integrate video ad rewards for gameplay benefits
tasks.details:
1. Research and select ad provider compatible with web/mobile
2. Implement ad SDK integration
3. Create reward options (extra balls, items, continues)
4. Implement ad viewing flow
5. Add reward distribution after successful ad view
6. Create fallback for ad failures
7. Implement ad frequency capping
tasks.testStrategy: Test ad loading and display. Verify rewards are correctly distributed after ad viewing. Test error handling for ad failures. Ensure ad integration doesn't negatively impact game performance.

tasks.title: Prepare for Mobile Adaptation
tasks.description: Modify the game architecture to support future mobile deployment
tasks.details:
1. Implement responsive design for different screen sizes
2. Create touch input system alongside mouse controls
3. Optimize asset loading for mobile bandwidth
4. Implement device detection for platform-specific features
5. Create mobile-friendly UI layouts
6. Research Capacitor/Cordova requirements
7. Document mobile adaptation plan for Phase 5
tasks.testStrategy: Test responsive design on different screen sizes. Verify touch controls work correctly in mobile browsers. Test performance on lower-end devices. Ensure UI is usable on smaller screens.
